definitions.definition: The act of marking off a boundary or setting a limit , notably by belligerents signing a treaty or ceasefire .
A limit thus fixed, in full demarcation line .

examples: There is an alleged, in fact somewhat artificial demarcation in the type of work done by members of different trade unions .

main_definition: The act of marking off a boundary or setting a limit , notably by belligerents signing a treaty or ceasefire .
secondary_definitions: A limit thus fixed, in full demarcation line .
